climbs.name: Short Circuit
climbs.fa: Eric Odenthal, John Cardmon & Brad Singer, July 2004

content.description: Short steep slab which eases near the top. Shares anchors with the wide crack to the right.
content.location: Left side of the west face.

climbs.name: Right Bandana Crack
climbs.fa: John Cardmon, Brad Singer & Eric Odenthal, July 2004

content.description: Starts in a chimney which soon narrows and forces you out onto the face. Good protection but a little awkward in spots.
content.location: The obvious wide crack on the left side of the east face.

content.description: Thin and delicate steep friction/face starting from the left arete and higher moving up and right to anchors. A little grainy but will clean up with more traffic.
content.protection:
TR from anchors on

Kodiak Arrest
content.location:
Just left of

Kodiak Arrest

on the narrow south face of the formation.

climbs.name: Left Bandana Crack
climbs.fa: Eric Odenthal, Brad Singer & John Cardmon, July 2004

content.description:
This is the obvious left-slanting wide crack in a flared left-facing corner which gets narrower at the top. Ends at shared anchors with

Short Circuit

.
content.location: The obvious crack on the right side of the west face.

climbs.name: Kodiak Arrest
climbs.fa: Chris Miller, Loren Scott & Pete Paredes, July 2002

content.description:
A difficult mantle start (5.10+) gains a crack/seam and then a small ledge. Above the ledge face climbing leads into a short section of crack and the top.

This, the first and perhaps still the best route on the formation, was originallyÂ done with 3 bolts and a key RP in a seam just below the current 2nd bolt (which was added later to make it better protected).
content.location: Right side of the narrow south face.
